data.description:
This is a paid watch-face. You can purchase this face individually for $0.99 or purchase our entire collection of 20+ faces for $5.99. You can purchase within the settings page.

It's time for Halloween! Looking for a creepy and spooky watchface for Halloween? This one is sure to impress your friends. So many features that make it scary and fun. Change the colors of the eyeball or the background color. Change what happens when you shake. Show the time digits in the corners. Customize the blinking of the eye. And more! We hope you enjoy our creepiest face yet!

Top Features Include:

-Customize the colors
-Fully customize what happens on shake
-Set how often the eye blinks
-Pebble OG Support, Pebble Time Support, and Time Round Support

data.description:
Simple, plain, Destiny inspired watch. First watchface attempt. Enjoy! Feel free to send in comments/suggestions.  Includes Date, Weather and battery level. Uses location from phone to display weather. 

Note* Battery level is the gauge at the top.  

NEW: Use the configuration page to pick either C/F for temperature. 24hr/12hr time depending on what your pebble time is set to display. Vibrate/BT Icon when bluetooth connection is lost.  

Donations appreciated: paypal.me/AsianButtahs

data.description:
It displays an analog clock "graduated".
Big point for the hours and a line for the minutes. No seconds hand to preserve battery.
Example in screenshot : 12h28 (or 00h28).

You can also see the date at center and a dotted line indicating the battery level at bottom. 

The "Bth Off" appears at top left if you loose connection with your phone (also vibes).

data.author: Angel O.

changelog.release_notes: Automatic hourly update of city and weather conditions added. Now, the watchface looks for the phone connection to refresh the city and weather conditions automatically each hour.

Hour hand movement added each 15 minutes to avoid mistakes reading the right time. If the hour hand does not move following the minutes hand, you will not sure if the right time is ten to two or two fifty. Now, the hour hand moves a quarter each 15 minutes.

First version of a Blue Analog watchface. 
Hours, minutes, seconds, day of the week & month, city and weather conditions with an elegant design.

data.author: Mike Hix

changelog.release_notes:
Bug fix release!

- Fixes location fetching bug
- Improves condition summary abbreviations
- Fixes other Javascript issues

DataFace now supports three weather APIs:
  - WeatherUnderground
  - Dark Sky (forecast.io)
  - OpenWeatherMap

It also has a hopefully less ambiguous summary abbreviation algorithm.

Support for other watch models/platforms is in progress.
Fixes the config page URL; github.com is deprecated for github pages. Use github.io instead.

Added support for manually setting a location.  This means you can fetch weather without using your phone's location services.

There's a bunch of JS clean-up and the HTML configuration page has been added to the git repository.
Color themes.

Multiple bug fixes, code clean-up, and project housekeeping.

- Fix a user-submitted bug where the date and calendar don't update.
- Fix a bug where the plugged in state didn't change the battery state.

Feel free to submit feature requests, pull requests, or open issues on this watchface's GitHub page: https://github.com/musl/DataFace
First release!

data.description:
A terse, no-foolin', nerdy watchface for utilitarian types. You'll need to plug in your OpenWeatherMap AppID after you install this.

New in v0.8: Bug fixes, weather conditions summary improvements.
New in v0.7: Support for Weather Underground and Dark Sky (forecast.io)
New in v0.6: Bug fixes and a nicer looking configuration page hosted on github!
New in v0.4: Manual Location Setting!
New in v0.3: Color themes!

Feel free to submit pull requests or open issues on this watchface's GitHub page! Use the source link below.

latest_release.release_notes:
Bug fix release!

- Fixes location fetching bug
- Improves condition summary abbreviations
- Fixes other Javascript issues

data.title: DataFace

data.author: Flav0ured

changelog.release_notes:
Version 4.5 - Weather marquee animation speed is now configurable
- Replaced snow symbol for precipitation (next three hours) and added additional rain symbol
- Smaller font for condition, equal to font for day of week
- Conditions layer now keeps its position and is no longer moved to the left, when precipitation symbol is shown
- Added options for week number standard
- Minor improvements for configuration page
- Fixed a bug where the temperature would alternate with empty space, when precipitation was chosen as secondary weather detail and there was no precipitation within the next three hours at all
- Fixed a bug where the configuration page would cause an error after canceling the configuration

Version 4.4

- Minor bug fixes

Version 4.3

- Minor source code optimizations
- Fixed a bug, where the animation of the weather marquee was not calculated correctly
- Fixed a bug, where the weather marquee animation was interrupted by tap events when not using the smart tap option

Version 4.2

- Precipitation within next three hours is now using two integers instead of floating point number to save a lot of memory
- Background image is now configurable, options are: None, Simple, Dynamic
- Background lines are now configurable, options are: None, Simple, Dynamic
- Fixed a bug where negative temperatures with two digits were not displayed correctly
- Fixed a bug where condition layer would interfere with seconds layer for certain conditions

Version 4.1

- Increased accuracy of precipitation within next three hours from integer to float with one decimal place
- Lowered threshold for precipitation within next three hours from 1 mm to 0.1 mm
- Extended both precipitation forecasts (next three hours and next 15 hours) to include snow
- Added symbol for precipitation within next three hours to distinguish between rain and snow
- Fixed a bug where the precipitation radar (next 15 hours) would eventually not show incoming rain
- Added both snow and rain symbols to represent a significant precipitation event within next 15 hours
- Fixed a bug where weather requests were attempted to execute although bluetooth connection was lost

Version 4.0

- Migration to Pebble SDK 4, Classic pebble watches only supported if running on latest software version 3.x using the new pebble app (grey icon)
- Fixed a bug where the Smart Tap Functionality would crash the watchface on all platforms other than Aplite when using the latest firmware version
- Minor improvements of TextLayer layouts and contents
- Added compatibility for Pebble 2 (Diorite)

Version 2.0

- Implemented downwards compatibility for classic pebble watches with software versions equal and above 2.0 and below 3.0, the latest software version requires the new pebble app (grey icon) instead of the old pebble app (red icon)

- Added day of week

- Hide day of week during weather marquee animation

- Do not show weather marquee if battery or bluetooth symbol is displayed

Version 1.10

- Fixed a bug where the request for weather information would not succeed on some mobile devices with android platforms

Version 1.9

- Changed design of the battery state display to fit the overall look of the watchface

- Added symbol for loss of bluetooth connection

- Reworked marquee:

  1. Temperature and humidity will not be part of the detailed weather information, if already shown below time

  2. Forecast for precipitation within next 15 hours will now be added to detailed weather information if above 1 mm instead of 7 mm

  3. Fixed some problems regarding the rendering of the marquee, if detailed weather information was too long

  4. Added 'Smart tap' option for more precise control over activating the detailed scrolling text when set set to 'Activate by shake'

  5. Detailed weather information will now contain a timestamp of the last time the weather data was updated

- Compatibility for watchface versions below version 1.4 has been ceased

- Minor improvements in the design of the config page

Version 1.8

- Fixed a bug, where shaking the pebble watch would still activate the marquee, even if deactivated through the config page

- Migration to Pebble SDK 3

Version 1.7

- Marquee with detailed weather information may now be activated either periodically as before or by shaking the pebble watch or both

Version 1.6

- Reworked config page (disable unnecessary controls dynamically, organize controls)

- Reworked website (comprehensive corrections concerning content and phrase with invaluable assistance of 'The Wetzelchen')

- Fixed a bug where the option 'Automatic' could not be chosen

Version 1.5

- Fixed a bug where the choice for the secondary weather detail was not saved correctly

Version 1.4

- Changed default interval for marquee to 10 minutes

- Fixed a bug where the weather forecast request failed, if no rain was predicted at all

- Added additional option 'Automatic' for alternating weather detail

Version 1.3

- Fixed a bug where some pixels at the end of temperature/humidity text were cut off

- Added request for precipitation forecast

- Replaced display for probability of precipitation with precipitation within next three hours

- Added information about first imminent increased precipitation within next 15 hours to marquee

Version 1.2
- Fixed bug where choice between humidity and probability of precipitation was not restored correclty when reopening the watchface
- Don't send request for probability of precipitation, if information is not shown on watch

Version 1.1
- Temperature unit is now configurable - available units: Celsius / Fahrenheit / Kelvin
- Config page extended, renamed and moved
Version 1.0

data.description:
Flav0ured Dynamic is a watchface designed for simplicity, aesthetics and compactness. It is driven by desire and the natural interest in the elements.
It provides a set of comprehensive yet simple settings and will adapt to differing needs.

Features
- Temperature now in Celsius, Kelvin or even (you won't believe your eyes) Fahrenheit!!!
- Neat and dynamic design
- Time (Surprise, surprise!!)
- Date (month, day and weeknumber)
- Weather (including temperature, condition, forecast precipitation, ...)
- State of charge (shown only while low or loading)
- Bluetooth connection (shown only if connection is lost)

latest_release.release_notes:
Version 4.5 - Weather marquee animation speed is now configurable
- Replaced snow symbol for precipitation (next three hours) and added additional rain symbol
- Smaller font for condition, equal to font for day of week
- Conditions layer now keeps its position and is no longer moved to the left, when precipitation symbol is shown
- Added options for week number standard
- Minor improvements for configuration page
- Fixed a bug where the temperature would alternate with empty space, when precipitation was chosen as secondary weather detail and there was no precipitation within the next three hours at all
- Fixed a bug where the configuration page would cause an error after canceling the configuration

data.title: Flav0ured Dynamic

data.author: Riley Brazell

changelog.release_notes:
Ver 2.0! Now with working features!
- rewrote watchface for Pebble API 3.0
- added compatibility with Chalk (round pebbles)
- using openweathermap for weather updates
- minor style changes
-- date and temperature switched sides
-- different font for temperature and date
-- display month as abbreviated name rather than date
-- probably the spacing is a bit different

Swapped from one weather API to another (more free) one since there were too many daily calls to the previous API! This is whats known as a good problem I think. The weather data from this new API is different but not less accurate, they pull weather data from different spots.

- Made weather updates only on shake event to save calls to phone (battery life)
- Removed old weather info while fetching new info so its easier to see that it succeeded and you have new temperature reading
---
- At this point the watchface is working just as I envisioned it so this will be the last update for a while. Next update will bring compatibility with other Pebble products, hidden secrets (if i can get them working correctly!), and other goodies.

Thank you so much to everyone that has liked and installed this! This is my first attempt at programming for the Pebble and I learned a lot. Thank you thank you thank you!
- Removed spooky surprise, it needs a couple more rounds of testing
Ditched psleep for much better AppTimer method! Shake to update weather! Sans now feels less lazy so he unwinks his eye! Also added a ~spooky surprise~ if you're up late!
Switched weather API for more accurate temperature results
Undertale Watchface for Pebble SDK 2.0, will run on Aplite (Pebble & Pebble Steel)

data.description: Simple Undertale-themed watchface for Pebble Classic and Pebble Steel! Shows local time, date, and temperature in Fahrenheit! Tap/shake the watch to get a wink from your good buddy Sans!

latest_release.release_notes:
Ver 2.0! Now with working features!
- rewrote watchface for Pebble API 3.0
- added compatibility with Chalk (round pebbles)
- using openweathermap for weather updates
- minor style changes
-- date and temperature switched sides
-- different font for temperature and date
-- display month as abbreviated name rather than date
-- probably the spacing is a bit different

data.title: Undertale Watchface

data.author: AAMP

changelog.release_notes:
Fixed bug on Android where the settings weren't being saved correctly (Pebble API bug converting bools to int/string).
The default for Show Sunrise/Sunset is now true, to make it the same as the original watch face app.
Fixed the sun image on Pebble/Steel.
Fixed a little bug - the first time you use the watch face both text and background came out black showing a blank face!!

Big update to little app! The watch face is now configurable and supports colour options (on colour devices).

- Updated to supports the SDK3 (so works on both Pebble/Steel and Pebble Time/Steel)
- Show temperature in Fahrenheit.
- Show sunrise/sunset times.
- Use the original digital font for Date, Time and Weather (options for each one).
- Choose text and background colours.
Fixed weather retrieval by applying for an API ID from openweather.
Slight vertical adjustment of items on screen.

New font and a small image to show sunrise/sunset times.
Updated with a check for bluetooth before it tries to communicate with the phone!
First release after testing.

data.description:
Digital watch with date, time, weather and sunrise/sunset times.

Top half shows date and time. Bottom section shows weather - current town, temperature and weather description as well as sunrise and sunset times for the current location (tests run in UK GMT).

Configurable views for Celsius/Fahrenheit, show sunrise/sunset, digital font and choose colours for text/background.

Low memory usage.

Weather retrieved every hour from OpenWeatherMap.org.

latest_release.release_notes:
Fixed bug on Android where the settings weren't being saved correctly (Pebble API bug converting bools to int/string).
The default for Show Sunrise/Sunset is now true, to make it the same as the original watch face app.

data.title: AAMP-Digital

data.description:
Design and Art Direction by Paul Joel - www.pauljoel.com

Simple and straightforward watchface with multi-language support. Featuring time, date, day of the week and battery percentage rendered in colorful neon effect. Configurable options include:

- Time format
- Date format
- Vibe on Bluetooth connect/disconnect
- Language selection

Pebble logo on top is a Bluetooth indicator, it disappears on Bluetooth disconnect.

data.description:
Watchface displays date, time and 2 bouncy status rings. One is coloured according to the bluetooth phone connection status - blue if connected, grey if not. The other indicates the battery status: it  shrinks and changes colour as the battery drains.

Only one ring is affected by gravity at any one time, this switches between rings when they collide.

data.description:
Notice: If you have Pebble Time, try newer version MarkHand3.


MarkHand 2 is a very configurable analog+digital watch.

Analog watch consist of hour mark and minute arm.

Dynamic 10 minutes dots appears nearby minutes 
arm. Its helps to know accurate minutes and keep the face simple.

Most of UI parts can be hide and you can keep the watch face simple.
And most of UI parts can show when you shake your arm and you can see more information at 5 seconds.


features which you can config are as follows.

[FACE]
- color thema (black/white/Blue/Green/Yellow/Brown/Pink)
- hour dots number (12/6/4/1)
- 10 minutes dots display (off/on)

[ARM]
- minute arm display (always/off/at shaked)
- hour arm movement (smooth/step hour/half smooth)
- hour arm layer (upper/lower)

[DIGITS]
- date display (off/always/at shaked)
- day of week display (off/always/at shaked)
- digital time display(off/always/at shaked)
- second display (off/always/at shaked)
- digital time type (12H/24H)
- date & time font type (7seg/SF)

[INDICATOR]
- battery indication icon display (off/always/at shaked)
- battery indicator type (icon/percent)
- Bluetooth indication icon display (off/always/at shaked)

[VIBES]
- vibe at every 0 minute (off/on)
- vibe at connection status changed (off/on)

latest_release.release_notes: - change setting page server

data.title: MarkHand2

data.description:
Animated Shovel Knight watchface greyscale-optimized for B&W / "OG" Pebbles. On bluetooth disconnect, the stars/fireflies disappear. To disable animation, simply give your wrist a vigorous little shake within 5 seconds of opening the watchface. Kind of a work in progress, if enough people download I might go ahead and add a separate animation for the daytime and tweak the existing animation a tad. 

Redrawn from Shovel Knight assets belonging to Yacht Club Games, no affiliation. (Thank you for a great game)

data.author: Imolex

changelog.release_notes:
Version 1.2. Now interactive!
Shaking the watch introduces a new random glider.
New glider no longer automatically added after 100 generations.
Evolves quicker - approx 2 generations per second.

Version 1.1:
Changed time font.
Uses SDK 3.6
Version 1.0

data.description:
Displays time with a 12x14 wrap-around Conway's Game of Life (B36/S23) in background. Starts with a randomly placed "glider". A new glider is added if you shake the watch, or if all cells die out. Cells are colour-coded according to their longevity.

The phone bluetooth connection is monitored every 10 seconds. If connection is lost the time will display pink and the watch emits one short vibration. When connection is restored, the time will be displayed in white and the watch will emit two short vibrations.

latest_release.release_notes:
Version 1.2. Now interactive!
Shaking the watch introduces a new random glider.
New glider no longer automatically added after 100 generations.
Evolves quicker - approx 2 generations per second.

data.title: Conway

data.description: This is my first attempt at creating a watch face and I have hopefully come up with one that is must for all Mariner fans.  This Grimsby Town FC watchface has all you need to view on your wrist with connectivity, date, time (of course), weather (via location and updates every 60 minutes) and battery.  It also has the magical Blundell Park and the Grimsby Town FC badge as a background :).  As my skills grow I will try and update this but I hope you enjoy my first effort, UTM !!! :)

data.description:
This is a paid watch-face. You can purchase this face individually for $0.99 or purchase our entire collection of 20+ faces for $5.99. You can purchase within the settings page.

Sometimes you just need some class and minimalism in your life. Minimal Orbit brings a simple, clean, and elegant look to your watch. It also supports the convenient shake to show info. Choose between showing the date or the weather or nothing. Also support the all new Pebble Time Round! Enjoy the simplicity and stay classy!

data.description:
It's a simple forecast watchface, with a bit of magic. Check out the website for a short video.

• Uses Yahoo, OpenWeatherMap, Dark Sky data
• Show forecast with a gentle wrist twist
• Lunar Phases (on clear nights)
• Sunrise, Sunset, and Precipitation* pins on Timeline
• Configurable alerts for bluetooth and battery
• Saves battery when your watch is at rest

If there's no rain during the week, the weekend forecast will be shown!

The forecast window has 3 columns:
Left - Today's forecast
Middle - Tomorrow's forecast
Right - If there's no rain on the day after tomorrow, it'll show the furthest available forecast

* Requires the "Smart Auto" weather provider to be set

latest_release.release_notes:
Added workaround for Yahoo GPS reverse geocoder.
Temporarily disabled Invert color function, will need to be re-implemented due to Pebble API changes.

data.title: Minimalist Weather

changelog.release_notes:
Time traveling is here!

* New animations & some graphics changes
* Time machine activation by shake
* Time traveling settings
* Working PM & second indicators
* Small fixes

* Charge/discharge animation
* Redrawn foreground images
* Small code improvements

Now it's working time machine!

* Added configurable destination time
* Added alarm on destination time reached
* Bugfix: hours drifting on tick

Version 1.1:
* Switched to SDK 3.6 (make sure, that you already installed 3.6 pebble time firmware)
* Flux animation
* Settings: animation every second/minute/off

First version of great Flux Capacitor watchface!

Version 1.0:
* Shows present time & destination time
* Looks nice!))

data.description:
Compact version of Flux Capacitor from Back to the Future trilogy for your Pebble Time. This working version of time machine can help you to travel in time.

October 21, 2015 already behind, but portable Flux Capacitor will help you not to forget about that!

Features:
* Looks nice!))
* Shows present time & destination time
* Flux animation
* Alarm on destination time reached (slow time machine)
* Show the battery current charge / charge state
* Instant traveling to the destination time on shake
* Working PM indicators
* Settings: animation every second/minute/off, destination time, time traveling
* Open source & content

TODO:
* Support int64_t to travel further in time

Donation:
If you like Back to the Future, you can support my open-source development by a small Bitcoin donation: 15phQNwkVs3fXxvxzBkhuhXA2xoKikPfUy

Thank you!

latest_release.release_notes:
Time traveling is here!

* New animations & some graphics changes
* Time machine activation by shake
* Time traveling settings
* Working PM & second indicators
* Small fixes

data.description:
Yet another weather watchface (Celsius).

Shows time and weather information such as:
Sunrise and sunset times at the top right (R: and S: respectively).
Wind speed, humidity and cloudiness at the middle right (m/s - meters/second, h: and c: respectively)
Also shows current temperature and max/min in Celsius and current condition.

Other features include:
Connection status with vibration alert for disconnect and reconnect and also a visual alert in the form of the indicator turning white on disconnect.

Charging indicator.

Shows the time at which the weather was last updated on the middle right with visual indication if it repeatedly failed to update the weather information for some reason.
Weather info auto updates every 30 minutes.

latest_release.release_notes: Fix min/max temps not showing.

error logs true

data.description:
Analog watchface with;
-Pebble Health step counter
-voice control for a NEW countdown timer, chronograph, calendar and weather forecast. Tilt the watch toward your face until you see a microphone on the left side of the screen (~45 deg toward you). Hold for 2 seconds to enter the dictation UI. NEW Say an amount of seconds, minutes and hours and "timer" to set a countdown timer. For example "one hour, five minute, 30 second timer". Say "forecast" for the 4 day forecast, "calendar" for a calendar, "start", "stop", "reset"  to control the chronograph or "steps" to send the previous days step count to the timeline (in case it did not automatically send after midnight). Drop your hand to your side to exit dictation UI, forecast or calendar.
-Optional second indicator. Say "second" to enable/disable.
-a 24 hour indicator (red circle)
-moon phase in the upper left
-current temp/weather conditions
-day/date 
-battery percentage

latest_release.release_notes: Updated to use the Pebble Health API for step counting

changelog.release_notes: v1.6 Battery usage improved by removing second hand and having the watch do nothing all minutes long. From 3.5 days to 5.5 days in my own usage. BlueTooth alert. It seems usefull to me now since I mute my phone.
v1.5 with battery optimisations to keep our Pebble far from a plug longer.
v1.4 is a copy of Big Analog White with black background

data.description: Big Analog watchface is a watchface for people like me that requires glasses to read small characters. Big date, long hands and neat design are the moto of this watchface. Also BT alert and watch battery.

data.author: orviwan

changelog.release_notes: Restored Aplite support, sorry :)

Added support for Pebble2 (Diorite)
Added 'Hide Branding' option for Diorite
Removed Aplite (Pebble Classic/Steel)
Added menu icon (SDK 4.0)
Added support for Timeline Quick View :)
Fix for Pebble Classic and Pebble Steel.

Now with Health data! Enable health on the settings page, then the watchface will show sleep stats in the morning, until your step count exceeds 400, then it will display your step count. Feedback welcome as always.
Fixed broken box border
Added support for Pebble Time Round!

Fixed a couple of tiny bugs, thanks to keen eyed @frogmatic for spotting these!

1. Time shadow was missing the middle bar when seconds enabled.
2. Time shadow now stays visible for the first digit when hours < 10.
Bug fix for crash on startup in certain circumstances.

This update has taken a while, but it's worth it!

Bug fixes! It's hard to believe, but there were a few minor bugs.

Realistic colours - The live preview now uses the realistic colour pallette.

Seconds are back! 

Switch Colour Set - Define a secondary colour scheme, then automatically switch from one to another at the specified time of day. e.g. Day/Night or Home/Office.

Power Save - Love using seconds, but hate the way it affects your battery life? Schedule power save in the evening, and automatically turn it off in the morning. During power save we disable bluetooth monitoring, blink, seconds, battery monitor and vibrations.

Who knows what features will be next, perhaps weather!
Added missing menu icon :)
Code fixes and optimizations by the excellent @Ron64
Minor font adjustments
Initial release of v3.0 for Pebble Time
Added a new double blink setting for the time separator. [Submitted by @ThiagoVinicius]
Optimised for better battery life. Previous update had increased the battery usage.

Added a new setting to toggle Seconds on and off.
Fixed bug which caused a vibration on startup
Added a new setting to hide the battery indicator, as requested by @mattss.
Fix for a pedantic user who spotted some issues with the number 1 character :)
Fix for a pedantic user who spotted some issues with the number 1 character :)
Double free crash

data.description:
Rebuilt from scratch for the Pebble Time to take full advantage of the colour screen. 

If you love it as much as I do, give it a LIKE!

Choose from predefined themes or design and share your own.

Features: 

- Fully customisable colour themes (with live preview)
- Preset colour themes
- Auto switch colour theme on Tap, or time of day
- Power Save (Disable power hungry features at specified time of day)
- Battery Level Indicator
- Blinking Time Separator (Single or Double)
- Inverted Colour 
- Bluetooth Connection Icon
- Bluetooth Disconnect Vibration 
- Hourly Vibration 
- Fully Configurable via Phone Settings

latest_release.release_notes: Restored Aplite support, sorry :)
